nodes.name: Definition of thinkOf
nodes.fol: (forall (a c) (iff (thinkOf a c) (exists (f) (and (focusOfAttention f a)(inm c f)))))
nodes.english: To think of some concept, entity, or eventuality is to have it in the focus of attention

nodes.name: Perception causes conscious thought
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1) (if (and (eventuality e)(perceive' e1 a e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (thinkThat' e2 a e)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If we perceive an eventuality, then defeasibly this causes us to think that it holds - we are conscious of it and we believe it

nodes.name: Perception causes belief in existence
nodes.fol: (forall (a x e1) (if (and (perceive' e1 a x)(etc)) (exists (e e2) (and (Rexist' e x)(thinkThat' e2 a e)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If we perceive anything, eventuality or not, then defeasibly this causes us to think that it really exists

nodes.name: Associations cause thinking chains
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a e1) (if (and (associated x y a)(thinkOf' e1 a x)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (thinkOf' e2 a y)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If two entities are associated for an agent, then thinking of one will defeasibly cause the agent to think of the other

nodes.name: Definition of predict
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1) (iff (predict' e1 a e) (exists (t1 e2 t2 e3) (and (atTime e1 t1)(atTime' e2 e t2) (not (before t2 t1)) (thinkThat' e3 a e2)(gen e3 e1)))))
nodes.english: To predict an eventuality is to believe it will occur at some time that is not before the time of the prediction

nodes.name: Causal belief generates prediction
nodes.fol: (forall (x y a e e1 e2 e3) (if (and (cause' e e1 e2)(thinkThat a e)(thinkThat' e3 a e1) (etc)) (exists (e4) (and (predict' e4 a e2)(cause e3 e4)))))
nodes.english: If an agent believes in a causal relation and thinks that the cause holds, then defeasibly the agent will predict the effect

nodes.name: Definition of validated prediction
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 t1) (if (and (predict' e1 a e)(atTime e1 t1)) (iff (validated e1) (exists (t2) (and (atTime e t2)(not (before t2 t1)))))))
nodes.english: If a predicted eventuality actually happens at some future time, then the prediction is validated

nodes.name: Definition of invalidated prediction
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 t1) (if (and (predict' e1 a e)(atTime e1 t1)) (iff (invalidated e1) (forall (t2) (if (not (before t2 t1))(not (atTime e t2)))))))
nodes.english: If it does not happen at some future time, the prediction is invalidated

nodes.name: Definition of explain
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1) (iff (explain a e e1) (exists (e2) (and (thinkThat a e2)(cause' e2 e1 e)))))
nodes.english: To explain an eventuality is to think that some specific eventuality caused it

nodes.name: Alternative causes trigger disjunctive thinking
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5) (if (and (believe a e3)(cause' e3 e1 e) (believe a e4)(cause' e4 e2 e)(thinkOf' e5 a e)(etc)) (exists (e6 e7) (and (thinkOf' e6 a e7)(or' e7 e1 e2)(cause e5 e6)))))
nodes.english: If agent a believes e1 can cause e and e2 can cause e, and a thinks of e, then that will defeasibly cause a to think of the disjunction of e1 and e2

nodes.name: Alternative effects trigger disjunctive thinking
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1 e2 e3 e4 e5) (if (and (believe a e3)(causallyInvolved' e3 e e1) (believe a e4)(causallyInvolved' e4 e e2) (thinkOf' e5 a e)(etc)) (exists (e6 e7) (and (thinkOf' e6 a e7)(or' e7 e1 e2)(cause e5 e6)))))
nodes.english: If the agent believes that an eventuality e could be a partial cause for eventuality e1 or could be a partial cause of eventuality e2, this defeasibly will cause the agent to think of the disjunction of e1 and e2

nodes.name: Definition of branch
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 s) (iff (branch e e1 e2 s) (and (member e s)(member e1 s)(member e2 s) (or (or' e e1 e2)(or' e e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: e is a branch to e1 and e2 in s exactly when e, e1 and e2 are all members of s and e is a disjunction of e1 and e2

nodes.name: Branch symmetry
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 s) (iff (branch e e1 e2 s)(branch e e2 e1 s)))
nodes.english: Branch is symmetric in its middle two arguments

nodes.name: Reified disjunction
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2) (iff (or' e e1 e2) (exists (e3 e4) (and (disjunct' e3 e1 e)(disjunct' e4 e2 e)))))
nodes.english: e3 is the relation of e1's being a disjunct in the disjunction e, and similarly for e4 and e2

nodes.name: Definition of csArc
nodes.fol: (forall (r e1 e2 s) (if (eventualities s) (iff (csArc r e1 e2 s) (or (and (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2) (member e1 s)(member e2 s)) (exists (e3) (and (member e1 s)(member e2 s)(member e3 s) (branch e1 e2 e3 s) (disjunct' r e2 e1)))))))
nodes.english: A causal system arc is either a causally involved relation or a relation between a disjunction and one of its disjuncts, that is, in a branch

nodes.name: Definition of causalSystem
nodes.fol: (forall (c) (iff (causalSystem c) (exists (v s) (and (componentsOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (eventualities v) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (exists (e1 e2) (csArc r e1 e2 v))))))))
nodes.english: c is a causal system if and only if c is a composite entity whose components are eventualities, and whose relations are causal links among these eventualities

nodes.name: Definition of eventualitiesOf
nodes.fol: (forall (c v) (if (causalSystem c) (iff (eventualitiesOf v c) (componentsOf v c))))
nodes.english: We will call the components of a causal system its eventualities

nodes.name: csArc extension to causal systems
nodes.fol: (forall (r e1 e2 c) (if (causalSystem c) (iff (csArc r e1 e2 c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(csArc r e1 e2 v))))))
nodes.english: It will be convenient to allow csArc to take causal systems as its fourth argument as well as sets of eventualities

nodes.name: Definition of causallyLinked
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2 c) (iff (causallyLinked e1 e2 c) (exists (r v s) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (member r s) (or (csArc r e1 e2 c)(csArc r e2 e1 c) (exists (e3 c0 s0) (and (or (csArc' r e1 e3 c) (csArc' r e3 e1 c)) (deleteElt s0 s r) (causalSystem c0) (eventualitiesOf v c0) (relationsOf s0 c0) (causallyLinked e3 e2 c0))))))))
nodes.english: Two eventualities e1 and e2 are causally linked in a causal system c if there is a chain of csArc relations in c between e1 and e2, regardless of direction

nodes.name: Definition of connected subsystem
nodes.fol: (forall (c1 e c) (iff (connSubCS c1 e c) (exists (v1 v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(eventualitiesOf v1 c1) (member e v)(member e v1) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 v1) (and (member e1 v) (or (equal e1 e) (causallyLinked e e1 c)))))))))
nodes.english: A connected subsystem c1 of a causal system c containing eventuality e

nodes.name: Definition of connected causal system
nodes.fol: (forall (c) (iff (connectedCausalSystem c) (exists (v s) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (member e1 v)(member e2 v)) (causallyLinked e1 e2 c)))))))
nodes.english: A connected causal system is a causal system in which all eventualities are causally linked by relations in the causal system

nodes.name: Definition of branchless causal system
nodes.fol: (forall (c) (iff (branchlessCausalSystem c) (exists (s1 s2) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (exists (e1 e2) (and (member e1 v)(member e2 v) (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2)))))))))
nodes.english: A branchless causal system is a causal system all of whose arcs are causallyInvolved relations, rather than disjunctions

nodes.name: Definition of isolated node
nodes.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (isolated e c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (not (exists (r e1) (or (csArc r e1 e c)(csArc r e e1 c))))))))
nodes.english: A node e is isolated with respect to a causal system c if there are no arcs into it and no arcs out of it

nodes.name: Definition of eventualityIn
nodes.fol: (forall (e c) (iff (eventualityIn e c) (exists (v) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v)))))
nodes.english: We will say that the members of the eventualities of a causal system are the eventualities in it

nodes.name: Definition of oneArcDiff
nodes.fol: (forall (c e1 r e2 c0) (iff (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0) (exists (v0 s0 v s d) (and (causalSystem c0)(causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v0 s0)(relationsOf s0 c0) (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (union v v0 d)(doubleton d e1 e2) (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2)(not (member r s0)) (addElt s s0 r)))))
nodes.english: The two causal systems c and c0 differ by only one arc, the arc r from e1 to e2. Causal system c will be the larger one, the one that is obtained by adding arc r to c0

nodes.name: Definition of delCSRel
nodes.fol: (forall (c2 c0 d) (iff (delCSRel c2 c0 d) (exists (v0 s0 s2) (and (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(relationsOf s0 c0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c2)(relationsOf s2 c2) (deleteElt s2 s0 d)))))
nodes.english: Causal system c2 results from deleting the relation d from causal system c0

nodes.name: Definition of resolveBranch (part 1)
nodes.fol: (forall (c e0 e1 e2 c0) (iff (resolveBranch c e0 e1 e2 c0) (exists (d c2 c1 v0 v v1) (and (causalSystem c0)(causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(eventualitiesOf v c) (branch e0 e1 e2 v0)(disjunct' d e2 e0) (delCSRel c2 c0 d)(connSubCS c1 e2 c2) (or (and (causallyLinked e1 e2 c2)(null v1)) (and (not (causallyLinked e1 e2 c2)) (eventualitiesOf v1 c1)))
nodes.english: Causal system c results from taking the branch from e0 to e1 and e2 in causal system c0 and resolving it to e1 (part 1 - complex definition continues)

nodes.name: Definition of contigCS
nodes.fol: (forall (c1 c2) (iff (contigCS c1 c2) (or (exists (e1 r e2) (or (oneArcDiff c1 e1 r e2 c2) (oneArcDiff c2 e1 r e2 c1))) (exists (e0 e1 e2) (or (resolveBranch c1 e0 e1 e2 c2) (resolveBranch c2 e0 e1 e2 c1))))))
nodes.english: Two causal systems are contiguous if they stand in oneArcDiff or resolveBranch relations

nodes.name: Symmetry of contigCS
nodes.fol: (forall (c1 c2) (iff (contigCS c1 c2)(contigCS c2 c1)))
nodes.english: The contigCS relation is obviously symmetric

nodes.name: Definition of envisioned causal system
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (ecs c a) (exists (v s) (and (causalSystem c)(eventualitiesOf v c) (relationsOf s c) (forall (e) (if (member e v)(thinkOf a e))) (forall (r) (if (member r s) (or (thinkOf a r)(believe a r))))))))
nodes.english: The agent a is thinking of every eventuality in the causal system, and the arcs in the causal system are either believed or in focus

nodes.name: Definition of backgroundBeliefs
nodes.fol: (forall (b a c) (if (ecs c a) (iff (backgroundBeliefs b a) (exists (v s) (and (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c) (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (member e1 b)(not' e2 e1)) (not (member e2 v)))) (forall (r e1 e2 e3) (if (and (causallyInvolved' r e1 e2) (not' e3 r)(member e3 b)) (not (member r s)))))))))
nodes.english: b is the set of agent a's background beliefs - negations of background beliefs are never in the causal system

nodes.name: Definition of ecsSeq
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (ecsSeq s a) (and (sequence s) (forall (c1) (if (inSeq c1 s)(ecs c1 a))) (forall (n n1 l c1 c2) (if (and (gt n 0)(length l s)(lt n l) (successor n1 n) (nth c1 n s)(nth c2 n1 s)) (contigCS c1 c2))) (exists (s0) (and (sequence s0) (forall (e1 n) (iff (nth e1 n s0) (exists (c1) (and (nth c1 n s) (ecs' e1 c1 a))))) (forall (n n1 l e1 e2) (if (and (gt n 0)(length l s0)(lt n l) (successor n1 n) (nth e1 n s0)(nth e2 n1 s0)) (change e1 e2))))))))
nodes.english: An envisioned causal system sequence is a sequence of envisioned causal systems in which successive causal systems are contiguous and linked by change-of-state relations

nodes.name: Definition of envisionedEv
nodes.fol: (forall (e s a) (iff (envisionedEv e s a) (exists (c) (and (ecsSeq s a)(inSeq c s)(eventualityIn e c)))))
nodes.english: An eventuality in any element of an envisioned causal system sequence is an envisioned eventuality

nodes.name: Definition of envisionFromTo
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (iff (envisionFromTo a e1 e2) (exists (s) (and (ecsSeq s a)(first e1 s)(last e2 s)))))
nodes.english: Envisioning a sequence from one causal system to another

nodes.name: Definition of envisionFrom
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (envisionFrom a e1) (exists (e2) (envisionFromTo a e1 e2))))
nodes.english: Less specific version - envisioning from a causal system

nodes.name: Definition of envisionTo
nodes.fol: (forall (a e2) (iff (envisionTo a e2) (exists (e1) (envisionFromTo a e1 e2))))
nodes.english: Less specific version - envisioning to a causal system

nodes.name: Person ability to envision
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s e1 c) (and (ecsSeq' e1 s a)(able a e1 c)))))
nodes.english: People have an ability to envision causal system sequences

nodes.name: Definition of thinkAbout
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (if (and (ecsSeq s a) (forall (c v) (if (and (inSeq c s)(eventualitiesOf v c)) (exists (e) (and (member e v)(arg* x e)))))) (thinkAbout a x)))
nodes.english: If every element of an ecsSeq includes a property of x among its eventualities, then the agent is thinking about x

nodes.name: Belief in causal systems
nodes.fol: (forall (a c v s) (if (and (causalSystem c) (eventualitiesOf v c)(relationsOf s c)) (iff (believe a c) (and (believe a v)(believe a s)))))
nodes.english: To believe a causal system is to believe the conjunction of the set of eventualities and the set of causallyInvolved relations that characterize the causal system

nodes.name: Real-world envisionments
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s t) (and (ecsSeq s a)(during s t)))))
nodes.english: Some envisionments are about events and states that happen in the real world at a particular time

nodes.name: Fictional envisionments
nodes.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (s) (and (ecsSeq s a) (forall (t) (not (during s t)))))))
nodes.english: Some envisionments are about fictional worlds, as in fiction and dreams, and have never happened and never will

nodes.name: Definition of changeGBel
nodes.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2) (iff (changeGBel a e d1 d2) (exists (e1 e2) (and (gbel' e1 a e d1)(gbel' e2 a e d2) (nequal d1 d2)(change e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: Agent a's belief in e changes from d1 to d2

nodes.name: Decreasing element belief decreases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c v) (if (and (ecs c a)(eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(gt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(gt d3 d4)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, decreasing the belief in an element of a causal system causes a decrease in the belief in the causal system as a whole

nodes.name: Increasing element belief increases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c v) (if (and (ecs c a)(eventualitiesOf v c)(member e v) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(lt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(lt d3 d4)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, increasing the belief in an element of a causal system causes an increase in the belief in the causal system as a whole

nodes.name: Decreasing relation belief decreases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a r d1 d2 c s) (if (and (ecs c a)(relationsOf s c)(member r s) (changeGBel a r d1 d2)(gt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(gt d3 d4)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, decreasing the belief in a relation of a causal system causes a decrease in the belief in the causal system as a whole

nodes.name: Increasing relation belief increases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e d1 d2 c s) (if (and (ecs c a)(relationsOf s c)(member r s) (changeGBel a e d1 d2)(lt d1 d2)(etc)) (exists (d3 d4) (and (changeGBel a c d3 d4)(lt d3 d4)))))
nodes.english: Defeasibly, increasing the belief in a relation of a causal system causes an increase in the belief in the causal system as a whole

nodes.name: Finding believed cause increases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(not (member e1 v0)) (believe a e1)(change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
nodes.english: If there is a change from entertaining causal system c0 to entertaining causal system c, where c includes a new possible cause that is already believed, this defeasibly causes an increase in belief in c0

nodes.name: Verified prediction increases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0)(member e1 v0) (eventualitiesOf v0 c0)(not (member e2 v0)) (believe a e2)(change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
nodes.english: There is a change in which the agent thinks of a new possible effect and already believes that to be true. This causes the agent's belief in the original causal system to increase

nodes.name: Falsified prediction decreases system belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a c c0 e1 e2 r e3 e4 v0) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (oneArcDiff c e1 r e2 c0)(eventualitiesOf v0 c0) (member e1 v0)(not (member e2 v0)) (not' e5 e2)(believe a e5) (change' e0 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c0 d1 d2)(lt d2 d1) (cause e0 e)))))
nodes.english: Predictions can also be falsified, and this decreases the degree of belief in the original causal system

nodes.name: Branch resolution with false belief increases alternative belief
nodes.fol: (forall (c c0 c1 c2 v1 e0 e1 e2 e3 e4 e5 e6 e7 d) (if (and (ecs' e3 c0 a)(ecs' e4 c a) (resolveBranch c e0 e1 e2 c0) (disjunct' d e2 e0)(delCSRel c2 c0 d) (connSubCS c1 e2 c2)(eventualitiesOf v1 c1) (member e5 v1)(not' e6 e5)(believe a e6) (change' e7 e3 e4)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (changeGBel' e a c d1 d2)(gt d2 d1) (cause e7 e)))))
nodes.english: Suppose a causal system has a branch in it, and a false proposition is found in the connected subsystem of one of the disjuncts. Then defeasibly there is an increased graded belief in the causal system with that branch resolved to the other disjunct

nodes.name: Definition of cwu0 (time-dependent)
nodes.fol: (forall (a c t) (iff (cwu0 c a t) (exists (e1 v) (and (ecs' e1 c a)(atTime e1 t) (eventualitiesOf v c) (forall (e2) (if (and (eventuality e2) (perceive' e3 a e2)(atTime e3 t)) (member e2 v)))))))
nodes.english: If the causal system includes all the eventualities that the agent perceives and the causal system is believed, then the envisioned causal system is the agent's current world understanding at time t

nodes.name: Definition of cwu (current)
nodes.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (cwu c a)(exists (t) (and (cwu0 c a t)(Now t)))))
nodes.english: A two-argument version of the predicate, by stipulating that t is Now. This has the effect of anchoring the current world understanding to the same time as the rest of the axiom

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
